Thanks St. Ack. It was a classpath problem, but not because being too
long.=
 

The problem was that I had the jars of lib directory before
heritrix-1.4=
.0.jar in the classpath. I think that there is some class
that are defined =
both in heritrix-1.4.0.jar, and in one of the jars of
the lib directory, an=
d heritrix needs the one defined in his own jar
to work correctly.



--- I=
